Transcript: [Western Union Telegram]  [September 28, 1934]  Received at Corner Washington Ave. & Rusk St., Marshall, Texas  1934 Sep 28 PM 4 31  MISS BIRD TAYLOR =  KARNACK VIA MARSHALL TEX =  UNLESS YOU WIRE WILL TELEPHONE SUNDAY EVENING SEVEN THIRTY SAME NUMBER LOVE =   LYNDON BAINES.   61F21  Will have call 4:35 P.  [Transcript prepared by LBJ Library staff, January 2013]
Title: Telegram, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, September 28, 1934
Creator: Lyndon Baines Johnson
Abstract: LBJ wires Lady Bird that he will call her on Sunday evening.
Collection: The Personal Papers of Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson are a collection of correspondence between Lyndon and Lady Bird Johnson that spans 1934 through 1968. During the Johnsons’ years in the White House, Dorothy Territo, a staff assistant who maintained files of high historical value, as well as family and genealogical material, had custody of the collection. In 1969, the files she kept came to Austin as part of President Johnson’s papers, which he had deeded to the U.S. government in August 1965.This collection includes the courtship letters between Lyndon Johnson and Claudia "Lady Bird" Taylor, from the period between their introduction and their marriage, September – November 1934.
Citation: “Telegram, Lyndon Johnson to Lady Bird Taylor, September 28, 1934,” Personal Papers of Lyndon B. and Lady Bird Johnson, LBJ Presidential Library, Dear Bird: The 1934 Courtship Letters, accessed November 27, 2016, http://archives.lbjlibrary.org/items/show/394.
